metadata.Title: CVE-2021-46671 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
options.c in atftp before 0.7.5 reads past the end of an array, and consequently discloses server-side /etc/group data to a remote client.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-46671` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

atftp - 0.7.git20120829-3.1~0.18.04.1+esm1
atftpd - 0.7.git20120829-3.1~0.18.04.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: atftp package in esm-apps/bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.7.git20120829-3.1~0.18.04.1+esm1').
